Module it.polimi.ingsw
Package it.polimi.ingsw.Client

Class ClientView

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.Client.ClientView
All Implemented Interfaces:
Observer<ServerEvent>
public class ClientView
extends java.lang.Object
implements Observer<ServerEvent>
This class is the core to manage a player during a game, observing the ServerEvent to update the client and calling the methods to send an event on the ClientSocketHandler.

  • Constructor Summary

    • loginQuestion

      public void loginQuestion​(java.lang.String username)
      Called when logging into a game passing the selected username. see LoginEvent
      Parameters:
      username - Name of the player

    • playableDivinitiesSelection

      public void playableDivinitiesSelection​(java.util.List<java.lang.String> playableDivinities, java.lang.String start)
      Sends the list of divinities that will be in game and the user that will start. It is sent after DivinitiesInGameEvent is received. See DivinitiesInGameSelectionEvent
      Parameters:
      playableDivinities - List of up to three divinities' names
      start - Username of the starting player

    • divinitySelection

      public void divinitySelection​(java.lang.String divinity)
      Calls a method on the socket to send the select the divinity. Sends DivinitySelectionEvent after DivinityInitializationEvent is received.
      Parameters:
      divinity - Divinity chosen by the player

    • workerPlacement

      public void workerPlacement​(int x1, int y1, int x2, int y2)
      Calls a method on the socket to place the workers on the model's board. It sends a WorkersPlacementSelectionEvent after a WorkerPlacementEvent is received.
      Parameters:
      x1 - First x woorker's coordinate
      y1 - First y woorker's coordinate
      x2 - Second x woorker's coordinate
      y2 - Second y woorker's coordinate

    • selectWorkerQuestion

      public void selectWorkerQuestion​(int x, int y)
      Sends an even to select the worker that will perform the actions until the end of the turn. WorkerSelectionQuestionEvent responding to WorkerSelectionEvent
      Parameters:
      x - Selected worker's x coordinate
      y - Selected worker's y coordinate

    • actionQuestion

      public void actionQuestion​(Action action, int x, int y)
      Posts the action that the selected worker will perform on the specified position.
      Parameters:
      action - One of the Actions. If the action is END, the coordinate will be (-1,-1)
      x - x coordinate to perform the action on
      y - y coordinate to perform the action on

    • manageSocketPort

      public void manageSocketPort​(int gamePort)

    • manageLogin

      public void manageLogin​(int id)
      It handles the login of the user on the selected UI. It is called through WelcomeEvent. See CLI.login() and LoginController
      Parameters:
      id - Unique id labelling the player

    • manageWrongUsername

      public void manageWrongUsername​(java.util.List<java.lang.String> usernames)
      Manages the case when a user selected an unavailable username or one with an unaccepted format. Caused by UsernameAlreadyUsed
      Parameters:
      usernames - List of already taken nicknames.

    • managePlayableDivinitiesSelection

      public void managePlayableDivinitiesSelection​(java.util.List<java.lang.String> divinitiesNames, java.util.List<java.lang.String> divinitiesDescriptions, int playersNumber, java.util.List<java.lang.String> players)
      Called when DivinitiesInGameEvent is received. The last user will get a list of all the divinities in the game with their description, the number of players and their names. Then it will select the divinities to make available during the game and the starting player. See CLI.selectPlayableDivinities(List, List, int, List) and DivinitySelectionController
      Parameters:
      divinitiesNames - names of all the divinities
      divinitiesDescriptions - description of the divinities' effects
      playersNumber - number of players in game
      players - names of the players

    • playersSetup

      public void playersSetup​(java.util.List<java.lang.String> playersNames, java.util.List<Color> colors)
      GameSetupEvent informs the client which color each player has
      Parameters:
      playersNames - list of players' names
      colors - list of colors for each player

    • setDivinitiesDescriptions

      public void setDivinitiesDescriptions​(java.util.List<java.lang.String> divinitiesNames, java.util.List<java.lang.String> divinitiesDescriptions)
      GameSetupEvent informs the client which divinity each player selected
      Parameters:
      divinitiesNames - List containing the name of each player's divinity
      divinitiesDescriptions - List of descriptions relative to each divinity

    • manageChooseDivinity

      public void manageChooseDivinity​(java.util.List<java.lang.String> availableDivinities)
      Called when DivinityInitializationEvent is received. It bears the divinities a user can choose from. See CLI.selectDivinity(List) and PlayerDivinitySelectionController
      Parameters:
      availableDivinities -

    • manageWorkersPlacementRequest

      public void manageWorkersPlacementRequest()
      Called when WorkerInitializationEvent is received. It tells the player that it is their turn to place their workers

    • manageWorkersInitialPlacement

      public void manageWorkersInitialPlacement​(java.lang.String username, int x1, int y1, int x2, int y2)

    • managePlayersDivinities

      public void managePlayersDivinities​(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,​java.lang.String> divinities)
      After DivinitiesSetupEvent. Maps each player to their divinities. GUI.playersDivinities() and CLI.playersDivinities()
      Parameters:
      divinities - Map

    • manageTextMessage

      public void manageTextMessage​(java.lang.String msg)
      Manages a TextMessageEvent CLI.textMessage(String) and GUI.textMessage(String)
      Parameters:
      msg -

    • manageStartTurn

      public void manageStartTurn()
      After StartTurnEvent. CLI.startTurn() and GUI.startTurn()

    • manageNewWorkerSelection

      public void manageNewWorkerSelection()
      After WorkerSelectionEvent. CLI.selectWorker() and GUI.selectWorker()

    • managePossibleActions

      public void managePossibleActions​(java.util.Map<Action,​java.util.List<Pair<java.lang.Integer,​java.lang.Integer>>> possibleActions)
      After PossibleActionsEvent. It informs the client which action are available and where they can be done. CLI.performAction(Map) and GUI.performAction(Map)
      Parameters:
      possibleActions - list of Action a user can perform

    • manageMove

      public void manageMove​(java.lang.String username, int fromX, int fromY, int toX, int toY)
      Tells the user where the specified player moved, updating the BoardRepresentation. CLI.moveUpdate(String, int, int, int, int) and GUI.moveUpdate(String, int, int, int, int)
      Parameters:
      username - player that moved
      fromX - initial moving position
      fromY - initial moving position
      toX - destination position
      toY - destination position

    • manageBuild

      public void manageBuild​(java.lang.String playerName, int x, int y, Action action)
      Tells the user where the specified player built, updating the BoardRepresentation. CLI.buildUpdate(String, int, int) and GUI.buildUpdate(String, int, int)
      Parameters:
      playerName - player building
      x - building position
      y - building position
      action - BUILD or BUILDDOME

    • manageLoser

      public void manageLoser​(java.lang.String username)
      Tells that the specified user lost. LoserEvent CLI.loser(String) and GUI.loser(String)
      Parameters:
      username - losing player

    • manageWinner

      public void manageWinner​(java.lang.String username)
      Tells that the specified user won. WinnerEvent CLI.winner(String) and GUI.winner(String)
      Parameters:
      username - winning player

    • managePlayerDisconnection

      public void managePlayerDisconnection​(java.lang.String username)
      Caused by a user disconnecting. PlayerDisconnectionEvent CLI.playerDisconnection(String) and GUI.playerDisconnection(String)
      Parameters:
      username - disconnected user

    • manageInLobby

      public void manageInLobby()
      Informs a player that they correctly joined a lobby. InLobbyEvent CLI.inLobby() and GUI.inLobby()

    • manageEndTurnEvent

      public void manageEndTurnEvent()
      Called at the end of a player's turn. EndTurnEvent CLI.endTurn() and GUI.endTurn()

    • manageInvalidMove

      public void manageInvalidMove​(java.util.Map<Action,​java.util.List<Pair<java.lang.Integer,​java.lang.Integer>>> possibleActions, int wrongX, int wrongY, int startX, int startY)
      Caused by an incorrect move InvalidMoveEvent. A map with the available actions and positions is sent alongside the incorrect coordinate. UI.invalidMove(Map, int, int, int, int) and UI.invalidMove(Map, int, int, int, int)
      Parameters:
      possibleActions - map of actions and list of positions available
      wrongX - wrong position sent
      wrongY - wrong position sent

    • manageInvalidBuild

      public void manageInvalidBuild​(java.util.Map<Action,​java.util.List<Pair<java.lang.Integer,​java.lang.Integer>>> possibleActions, int wrongX, int wrongY, int actualX, int actualY)
      Caused by an incorrect build InvalidBuildEvent. A map with the available actions and positions is sent alongside the incorrect coordinate. UI.invalidBuild(Map, int, int, int, int) and UI.invalidBuild(Map, int, int, int, int)
      Parameters:
      possibleActions - map of actions and list of positions available
      wrongX - wrong position sent
      wrongY - wrong position sent

    • manageInvalidWorkerPlacement

      public void manageInvalidWorkerPlacement()
      When a player places a worker on another one InvalidWorkerPlacementEvent CLI.invalidWorkerPlacement() GUI.invalidWorkerPlacement()

    • manageInvalidWorkerSelection

      public void manageInvalidWorkerSelection​(int wrongX, int wrongY)
      Consequence of a bad worker selection. It returns the bad coordinated InvalidWorkerSelectionEvent CLI.invalidWorkerSelection(int, int) GUI.invalidWorkerSelection(int, int)
      Parameters:
      wrongX - wrong coordinate
      wrongY - wrong coordinate

    • startGame

      public void startGame()
      Called when the game begins CLI.startGame() GUI.startGame()

    • lobbyFull

      public void lobbyFull()
      Called from LobbyFullEvent because the user tried to connected once the game already started.

    • manageServerDisconnection

      public void manageServerDisconnection()
      Called when the server cannot be reached.

    • update

      public void update​(ServerEvent event)
      Called when a ServerEvent is received. The package is extracted and the method on the incoming event overrides a method on ClientView
      Specified by:
      update in interface Observer<ServerEvent>
      Parameters:
      event - Incoming event

    • startConnection

      public void startConnection()
      Opens the client connection starting a ClientSocketHandler. The ip and the port are either passed as parameters in the constructor of ClientView or they are retrieved from an xml file.

    • disconnect

      public void disconnect()
      Method that causes to close the client socket. It is caused by a generic user's connection problem, by a full lobby event or by the presence of winner

    • resetBoard

      public void resetBoard()
      Resets the client's BoardRepresentation at the end of the game, building a new one
